fields.value: Consolidated Federal Funds Report (CFFR), Fiscal Year 1994

authorName.value: United States Department of Commerce. Bureau of the Census

authorAffiliation.value: United States Department of Commerce. Bureau of the Census

dsDescriptionValue.value:
The Consolidated Federal Funds Report CFFR data, obtained  from federal government
agencies, cover federal expenditures or  obligations for the following categories: grants, salaries and wages,  procurement contracts, direct payments for individuals, other direct  payments, direct loans, guaranteed or insured loans, and  insurance. Information available in the CFFR Data File (Part 1)  includes FIPS geographic code, state abbreviated name, county name,  place name, population, congressional district code, program  identification code, object/assistance type code, agency code, and  amount in whole dollars. For each unique FIPS code all programs are  listed, and for each program all records with different object  categories are listed. The CFFR Program Identification File (Part 2)  contains program identification codes and their respective program  titles. The CFFR Federal Agency File (Part 3) contains all four-digit (FIPS-95) codes identifying specific agencies.

topicClassValue.value: ICPSR VIII.C. Governmental Structures, Policies, and Capabilities, Statistics on Government Operations

distributorAffiliation.value: Institute for Social Research, University of Michigan

value: (1) United States government agencies, including the  Federal Assistance Award Data System (FAADS), Federal Procurement Data  System, Office of Personnel Management, Department of Defense, Postal  Service, Internal Revenue Service, Coast Guard, Public Health Service,  National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, and Federal Bureau of Investigation, and (2) Census Bureau's Federal Aid to States survey

Federal government expenditures or obligations in state,  county, and subcounty areas of the United States. United States  territories (American Samoa, Guam, Northern Mariana Islands, and Puerto Rico) and the District of Columbia are included.
